poem:
**Evening Strike**

Amid the clamor
where pleasure and steel
graze—
Mussie's fate

stirred—

Queensway hums
yet quiet falls.
The blade
pierces the night,
laughter
turns to gasps,
kitchens to shadows,
and the heart—
to an alley.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Swedish chef in critical condition after attack near Notting Hill carnival A Swedish chef who had worked under Gordon Ramsay is in critical condition after being attacked near Notting Hill carnival on Monday. Mussie Imnetu, 41, the head chef at the Arts Club in Dubai, was visiting London on a business trip. At about 11.20pm on Monday, Imnetu was attacked at the Dr Power restaurant in Queensway. The Metropolitan police said customers in the restaurant". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
